description: A CIDR provisioned to an IPAM pool.

Cidr.description: The CIDR provisioned to the IPAM pool. A CIDR is a representation of an IP address and its associated network mask (or netmask) and refers to a range of IP addresses. An IPv4 CIDR example is `10.24.34.0/23` . An IPv6 CIDR example is `2001:DB8::/32` .

IpamPoolId.description: The ID of the IPAM pool.

NetmaskLength.description: The netmask length of the CIDR you'd like to provision to a pool. Can be used for provisioning Amazon-provided IPv6 CIDRs to top-level pools and for provisioning CIDRs to pools with source pools. Cannot be used to provision BYOIP CIDRs to top-level pools. "NetmaskLength" or "Cidr" is required.
